result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. John J Sampe

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Cases 14CM278, 15CM82, 15CT70, 15CM128 called at 10:58am [mo]
Defendant John J Sampe in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  DA Susan Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
DA Susan Happ indicates 15CM128 will be part of the plea agreement although an initial appearance has not yet occurred.
 
Initial Appearance conducted in 15CM128:
Service of Complaint admitted; recited charge and maximum penalties 

Maximum penalties recited; Constitutional rights reviewed; plea of "Guilty" entered on Case 14CM278 Count #2, Case 15CM128 Count #1 and Case 15CT70; factual basis stipulated; victim rights compliance verified; the Court accepts the pleas, finds Defendant guilty, and orders Judgment of Conviction entered.

On Motion of the State, the Court reads-in and dismisses Case 15CM82 and all remaining counts of Cases 14CM278, 15CM128.

Sentencing arguments given by DA Happ
Sentencing arguments given by Atty. Luchsinger
The Court inquires about Mr. Sampe's current address; Mr. Sampe indicates he now has a Necedah, WI address
Mr. Sampe gives statement and has colloquy with the Court 

On Case 14CM278 Count #2 and Case 15CM128 Count #1, the Court withholds sentence, and places Defendant on Probation for 1 year, with conditions:

--undergo Anger Management and/or Batterer' Intervention and/or any other assessment, treatment or counseling as deemed appropriate by the Agent
--no contact with Corey Carlton (violation of Court's order is a violation of 973.049 and 941.39)
--no possession of dangerous weapons
--no acts or threats of violence to anyone 
--no possession or consumption of alcohol
--no presence in bars, taverns, or liquor stores
--On Case 14CM278 Count #2 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge
 plus the $100 Domestic Abuse Surcharge plus $95 in subpoena fees plus $54.98 in summons fees
--On Case 15CM128 Count #1 to pay costs of $243 plus the $200 DNA surcharge

The Court allows this Probation term to be transferred to Juneau County, WI

On Case 15CT70:
The Court sentences the Defendant to pay a fine of $ 25 + costs = $484.50; to be paid in $30 per month installments commencing on May 15, 2015 and on the 15th  day of each month thereafter until paid in full. Non-payment shall result in a 9 day jail term, with Huber privileges consecutive.



On Case 14CM278: Days credit for time already served:  0  days
On Case 15CM128:  Days credit for time already served:  0  days
recess11:26am

ADDRESS INFO for John J Sampe
Current: N13916 9th Ave., Necedah, WI 54646 United States  (Effective: 04-24-2015)
Prior: N2449 Kutz Rd, Fort Atkinson, WI 53538
NOH for def sent to LKA
Status conference on April 24, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Pre-trial conference on April 15, 2015 at 02:20 pm.
Scheduling Notice; Your Right to Legal Representation in a Criminal or Criminal Traffic Case

Cases 14CM278, 15CM82, and 15CT70 called at 9:10 [mo]
Reserve Judge Sarah O'Brien presiding for Branch IV
Defendant John J Sampe in court with Attorney Steven J. Luchsinger.  Susan Victoria Happ appears for the State of Wisconsin.
Atty. Luchsinger indicates he is appointed as counsel in case 14CM278, and that he will represent Mr. Sampe pro bono on 15CM82 and 15CT70

As to case 14CM278:
Atty. Luchsinger indicates that a resolution has not been met, and expects Jury Trial to remain on calendar for Monday.
The Court suspends the order for attorney fees, further the Court notes that the fees should be re-evaluated at the conclusion of the case.
The Court directs Mr. Sampe to go to the PD office, and seek approval to have Atty. Luchsinger apponted on all three pending cases. 
Atty. Luchsinger indicates that this case continues to be contested and will proceed to Trial. 
Atty. Luchsinger raises concern about the Defense learning the Sheriff's Dept in continuing to interview a witness. Atty. Luchsinger wants to be sure that Discovery is provided. 
DA Happ indicates that the State does not have possession or control of this information, and that the interviews of the witness are being done in relation to a possible bond violation, it does not relate to the case which is preceeding to trial(14CM278).
The Court reviews statutes pertaining to witness statements. 
DA Happ agrees to contact the Juneau Co. Sheriff's office to inquire about their contacts with Ms. Carlton. 
Atty. Luchsinger discloses a defense rebuttal witness; Loretta Walker
Atty. Luchsinger agrees with the State's Motion to Impeach 
The Court finds that Mr. Sampe has 11 prior convictions 
Atty. Luchsinger indicates that their are no objections to the State's Notice to Admit Statements. 

Initial Appearance occured in case 15CM82: 
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited.
 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

Inital Appearance occured in case 15CT70:
Defendant verifies that the date of birth and address listed on the Criminal Complaint are correct. 
Service of Complaint admitted, reading waived, the charge and maximum penalties are recited. 
Plea of "not guilty" entered; speedy trial waived by the Defendant

As to both 15CM82 and 15CT70 The Court requires $ 500 signature bond, with conditions: 
--not operate a motor vehicle without a valid lisence  
--to report to the Jefferson County Sheriff's Department for booking today.
recess
: 9:32am 


NEXT:  (1) Pretrial Conference on 4/15/15 at 2:20pm     (2)  Status Conference on 4/24/15 at 10:00am (3) Jury Trial for 14CM278 remains on the Court's calendar for 4/6 & 4/7
